caption.center: PAMELA CONGO, Respondent Below-Appellant, v. CHRISTOPHER GIBSON,

opinion.opinion_text:
Unpublished Opinion is below.
PAMELA CONGO, Respondent Below-Appellant, v. CHRISTOPHER GIBSON, Petitioner Below-Appellee. No. 49, 2000. In the Supreme Court of the State of Delaware. Submitted: May 16, 2000. Decided: June 18, 2000.
Appeal from Family Court of the State of Delaware, in and for New Castle County, No. CN88-9778, No. 99-07486
Before WALSH, Justice.
Joseph T. Walsh, Justice
ORDER This 2nd day of June 2000, the Clerk having issued a notice dated May 16, 2000, directing the appellant to show cause why this appeal should not be dismissed, pursuant to Supreme Court Rule 29(b), for her failure to diligently prosecute the appeal by failing to pay to Family Court the filing fee; and appellant having failed to respond to the notice to show cause within the required ten-day period, dismissal of this action is deemed to be unopposed.
NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Supreme Court Rules 3(b) and 29(b), that the within appeal is DISMISSED.
